U.S hedge fund Elliott Management has reportedly written off Milan’s debts, having taken over from Yonghong Li.

The Chinese owner had to borrow around €180m from the fund to pay for his takeover, while the club itself was loaned €73m initially, which rose to €128m to pay players and clear bank debt.

Those loans also carried a high interest rate, but MilanNews reports that after seizing control of the club the hedge fund has cleared the debt.

Elliott is now expected to inject around €50m to stabilise the Rossoneri’s finances, with a focus now on gradual investment to respect Financial Fair Play rules.

The hedge fund plans to sell the club on, but must ensure that Milan are no longer in financial difficulty to make them attractive to new owners.

Today's board meeting at Casa Milan has just ended. On July 21, the big assembly will be officially held, with the aim of:
- Renewing the board of directors
- Revoking some advisors
- Appointing the new president of Milan (Paolo Scaroni)

Agent: ‘Kalinic will prove himself’


The agent of Milan striker Nikola Kalinic says his client will “prove his worth”, and discusses his exclusion by Croatia.

The forward refused to come on in his country’s first World Cup game against Nigeria, claiming that he had a back problem.

His compatriots reached the final last night with a 2-1 win over England, meaning Kalinic has missed out on Croatia’s greatest footballing achievement so far.

“It’s pointless to talk about it now, what happened has happened and life goes on,” Tomislav Erceg said on Radio Sportiva.

“Unfortunately this year didn’t go well, he’ll soon prove his worth but I’m not talking about the transfer market.”

Suso agent meets Chelsea?

Milan winger Suso’s agent reportedly met Chelsea this week to discuss a potential €40m transfer.

The Spain international and former Liverpool player had already been heavily linked with Napoli when Maurizio Sarri was in charge.

Now that Sarri’s appointment at Stamford Bridge seems imminent, replacing Antonio Conte, it makes sense for Suso to be a target there too.

According to Calcionews24, agent Alessandro Lucci met with Chelsea in London on Tuesday.

He also represents Chelsea full-back Davide Zappacosta, but a Suso move does make a great deal of sense.

Milan were excluded from Europe due to Financial Fair Play violations and have just been taken over by hedge fund Elliott Management after Yonghong Li defaulted on his debts.

If they are to sell players in order to improve their financial standing, Suso is the ideal candidate, because he’ll command €40m and cost only €1.3m to get from Liverpool in January 2015.

所有克羅地亞人都沉浸在晉級決賽的喜悅中，恐怕只有一個人不知作何滋味，卡利尼奇，你還好嗎？

　　在創歷史的擊敗英格蘭後，不少網民紛紛在網上@卡利尼奇，我們先看看他們都說了什麼。　　



　　「比糟糕更糟的就是卡利尼奇」

　　「國米的比列錫一傳一射，祖記的文素基治鎖定勝局，米蘭的卡利尼奇第一天就被送回家！」

　　「我們先不要嘲諷英格蘭了，把這個時間留給卡利尼奇！」

　　這一切都要從克羅地亞與尼日利亞之戰說起，第85分鐘，達利奇讓卡利尼奇去熱身準備上場，不過後者以背部不適為藉口拒絕了，達利奇沒有當場發作，而是讓年輕的柏積卡登場。

　　這不是卡利尼奇第一次拒絕後備登場了，在之前與巴西的熱身賽中他就幹過一次了，克羅地亞媒體解讀，這是因為卡利尼奇認為自己不滿意後備角色，可問題是，當你的競爭對手是文素基治時，你還有優勢嗎？

　　達利奇在賽後徵求了幾位核心球員的意見，最終做出了將卡利尼奇開除出隊的決定，後來有報導稱，卡利尼奇在離開的時候向全隊發了一條信息，結果只有兩位小將回覆了他，場面十分尷尬。

　　出了這一檔子事兒之後，只剩22人的克羅地亞卻曆經三個加時晉級了決賽，創造歷史最佳戰績。

　　卡利尼奇不光在國家隊鬧脾氣，這一個賽季在意甲非常不順，他也沒少惹事。

　　為了圓兒時一個夢想，卡利尼奇去年夏天不惜與費倫天拿鬧翻，最終如願披上米蘭7號波衫，不過強扭的瓜不甜，卡利尼奇過去這個賽季過得十分掙扎，蒙迪拿和加度素都給過他機會，但他經常在關鍵時刻掉鏈子，一個賽季下來只為米蘭攻入6個入球。

　　場上的不順也轉化為場外的焦躁，與基爾禾一戰之前，加度素直接將其排除出大名單，他後來解釋道，在訓練中希望看到所有球員都在拚盡全力，需要在比賽之外看到職業素養……這話顯然是說給卡利尼奇聽的。

　　其實卡利尼奇還有別的選擇，簡拿華路在權健時期就非常想引進他，後來卡帥重返恒大仍然沒斷了這個念想，只不過心高氣傲的卡利尼奇從不把中超放在眼裡。

　　而經過世界盃這出鬧劇後，本就狀態不佳的卡利尼奇已經被米蘭放棄，而下家們也紛紛猶豫不決，中超？夠嗆了！他很可能因此葬送了本就不多的職業生涯。

　　鬧騰了一年的卡利尼奇如今只能坐在電視機前，很可能看著自己的祖國一鼓作氣拿下世界盃，一言難盡啊。

　　就像一位國外網民說的一樣，「做人別太卡利尼奇！」
卡利尼奇別委屈自己，去中超當個皇帝吧，還有6小時可以走

Elliott's plan to restore Milan from the mishandling by Yonghong Li and co, will involve 2 main steps: Healthy management & Brand Marketing.

It is likely that new players will arrive at the club, but this has to be done according to FFP rules, involving a proper balance of purchases and sales.

In order to increase revenues, Elliott will focus on 2 aspects: revenue from playing European Football and brand marketing. They have shown willingness to enhance Milan's brand through various different channels.

Milan's current value is estimated to be around €550m. Elliott will keep the club to make it more valuable before eventually selling it at a higher price. [La Gazzetta dello Sport]

Tuttosport reports that Atletico Madrid are ready to step up efforts to sign Nikola Kalinic from Milan.

The Croatian forward has endured a difficult year, falling out with Rossoneri Coach Rino Gattuso before being sent home from Croatia’s World Cup squad for refusing to come on as a substitute.

He appears set to leave the San Siro, with Atletico poised to offer him the chance of a fresh start in La Liga.

And in the coming days, it is expected that the Rojiblancos will push to reach an agreement for the signing of the 30-year-old forward.

Milan, who only signed Kalinic from Fiorentina last summer, are reluctant to allow him to leave for anything less than €20m.

Gazidis in, Fassone out at Milan?

Milan owners Elliott Management are reportedly keen to bring Arsenal chief executive Ivan Gazidis on board, replacing CEO Marco Fassone.

The U.S hedge fund has seized control of the club from Yonghong Li, and is in the process of overhauling the board.

According to this morning’s Corriere della Sera, Gazidis remains the prime candidate to join the board, where it’s likely he’d replace Fassone.

Leonardo, a former Rossoneri player and Coach, will likely be appointed as technical director.

Fassone and sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli are both currently in London, where they're expected to meet with Elliott and be told of their future.

Elliott's three-year Milan plan

Elliott Management aim to control Milan for three years and not one, it’s reported, selling two per cent to Riccardo Silva.

According to Sky Sport Italia, the takeover after President Yonghong Li defaulted on his debts won’t be a short-term operation seeking a new buyer.

The idea would be to set up a three-year project to get the club back on track, raise its value and then sell at a large profit.

Current directors Marco Fassone and Massimiliano Mirabelli would continue to work with the club, but slowly be edged out by new chiefs, most likely Leonardo.

La Repubblica, meanwhile, point to Frank Tuil as Elliott’s main representative on the Board of Directors, which will be formed on July 21.

Ivan Gazidis would be tough to get hold of due to his current salary at Arsenal.

Although a sale of the club isn’t planned for a while, Sky do point to handing two per cent over to Riccardo Silva, co-owner of Miami FC and with strong links to the development of the sport in America.

He also has very close ties to Rossoneri legend Paolo Maldini.

It was said today on SportMediaset that Antonio Conte was being considered as a replacement for Gennaro Gattuso, but most other Italian sources see nothing behind the rumour.

Milan, piace il talento del Flamengo Paquetà

Il Milan sarebbe interessato al centrocampista del Flamengo Lucas Paquetà. Il giovanissimo talento, è un 1997, secondo quanto riferito dal tabloid inglese Daily Mirror tuttavia sarebbe seguito da numerose squadre europee tra cui Juventus, Manchester City, Liverpool e Chelsea. Il Milan è sulle tracce di Alvaro Morata, ma nei colloqui con il Chelsea, al ds rossonero Massimiliano Mirabelli sarebbero stati proposti Olivier Giroud e Michy Batshuayi, i quali sarebbero entrambi in vendita. Lo riferisce questa mattina Tuttosport, che spiega che in particolare intriga il profilo del belga, la cui valutazione però è di 55-60 milioni di euro.
傳緊兩件買哂？
